case_circumstances: On 11/01/1997, while unloading steel beams from a railroad car, employees of O'Neal Steel discovered the decomposing remains lying underneath the steel beams inside the railroad car.  The railroad car was loaded at Northwestern Steel and Wire Company in Sterling, IL on 9/29/1997 and had been sitting on the O'Neal Steel lot since approximately 10/28/1997.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: One green in color short sleeve knit shirt with empty left breast pocket, manufactured by "Jantzen".  One pair of size 34 slacks, with cuffed pants legs, empty pockets, and a tag for the company "Pertex" inside the waistband. One pair of size 34 white briefs.
case_footwear: One pair of heavy, dark work shoes (unknown size), with "oil and chemical resistant" written on the soles.  One pair of aqua colored socks.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
